title: N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. tit. 18, ch. II, subch. A, art. 5, pt. 347 - Establishment of Parentage and Enforcement of Child Support
content:
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. tit. 18, ch. II, subch. A, art. 5, pt. 347 - Establishment of Parentage and Enforcement of Child Support

State Regulations
§ 347.1 - State division of child support services
§ 347.2 - Definitions
§ 347.3 - Local district child support enforcement unit
§ 347.4 - Cooperative agreements and purchase of service agreements
§ 347.5 - Cooperation determination and claims of good cause for refusal to cooperate
§ 347.6 - Establishment of parentage
§ 347.7 - Location of noncustodial parents/alleged parents/intended parents and sources of income or assets
§ 347.8 - Establishment, modification, and enforcement of support obligations
§ 347.9 - Enforcement of support obligations and issuance of income withholding orders
§ 347.10 - Child support standards (Repealed)
§ 347.11 - Cooperation with other States and social services districts
§ 347.12 - Reporting support collections for public assistance, medical assistance-only and foster care cases
§ 347.13 - Distribution and disbursement of support collections
§ 347.14 - Reimbursement to local districts
§ 347.15 - Reimbursement to the State
§ 347.16 - Federal incentive payments
§ 347.17 - Child support services available to individuals not otherwise eligible and to individuals who become ineligible for public assistance and care or whose children are ineligible for foster care
§ 347.18 - Records and reports
§ 347.19 - Use and Disclosure of Confidential Information and Credit Reporting
§ 347.20 - Title of proceedings
§ 347.21 - Allocation of statewide goal by commissioner
§ 347.22 - Failure to meet the collections goal
§ 347.23 - Request for redetermination
§ 347.24 - Case closing criteria
§ 347.25 - Desk reviews of the distribution and disbursement of support collections
§ 347.26 - Review and adjustment of child support orders (Repealed)

Notes
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. tit. 18, ch. II, subch. A, art. 5, pt. 347

Statutory authority: Social Services Law, §§ 20, 34, 101, 111-a, 111-b, 111-c, 111-g, 111-h[9], 111-i, 111-k, 111-r, 111-s, 111-v, 143, 398.6, 349-a, 364; Public Health Law, §4135-b; L. 1993, chs. 53, 59; L. 1994, ch. 170; L. 1995, ch. 81; L. 1996, ch. 474; Family Court Act, §542; 42
USC, §
666
[c][1]
State regulations are updated quarterly; we currently have two versions available. Below is a
comparison between our most recent version and the prior quarterly release. More comparison features will be added as we have more versions to compare. No prior version found.
